thread.title: Watch: Iraqi boy with no hands singing John Lennon’s Imagine will melt your heart!

author: dna webdesk
title: Watch: Iraqi boy with no hands singing John Lennon’s Imagine will melt your heart!
text:
YouTube Screen Grab If John Lennon had been alive today, he would have been 75 years old and shocked by the state of the world, torn apart by religion and wars. One of those affected by other people’s violence was Emmanuel Kelly, who was abandoned by his parents as a baby. Emmanuel was born with limb deficiencies as a result of chemical warfare in Iraq.
He was raised at an orphanage run by Mother Theresa nuns and then rescued from there by his mother Moira Kelly and raised in Australia. In 2011, he participated in X-Factor and sang John Lennon’s Imagine which moved the judges to tears (and tears look more real than anything we’ve seen on reality shows). It's even more touching that he chooses to sing a song like Imagine, particularly after violence he faced earlier in life. (Read: 6 songs that defined John Lennon )
Emmanuel’s rendition was so beautiful that even Lennon’s wife, Yoko Ono was touched and tweeted: “ Thank you, Emmanuel. You sang beautifully! Thank you. John would have been proud of you. Thank you, thank you, thank you. Love, Yoko”.
